class Control

Detailed Description

A Drawable Object is the base for all objects, which have the ability to be drawn inside a rectangulary area of a device-context. Drawable objects are slicker than controls and cannot have a focus and hence no interaction. After initializing a drawable object it is drawn automatically by APOXI to the given bounding-rectangle. It is recommended to adjust the position and size of the drawable object dynamically in the method OnLayoutClient of the parent control.

Member Enumeration Documentation

anonymous enum
 

Enumerator:
ID 

Reimplemented from Component.

enum DrawableObject::ParentArea
 

Every drawable-object may added as part of the client area or the frame area of the parent control. Per default a drawable-object is added as part of the client area.

See also:
SetParentArea

GetParentArea

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

DrawableObject::DrawableObject (   ) 
 

If the default constructor is used, the parameters have to be provided by using the method Init.

DrawableObject::DrawableObject (  Control *  parent,
BOOLEAN  add_to_parent = TRUE,
const View *  view = 0
) 
 

Parameters:
parent Pointer to the control, where the drawable object should be drawn.
add_to_parent Indicates, whether the drawable object should be added to the parent control. When the drawable object is added to the parent control, the drawable object is drawn automatically in the client area of the parent control. Pointer to the view, which is responsible to draw the drawable object.

DrawableObject* DrawableObject::GetNext (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns the next drawable object for the concatenated list. It is recommended to use the ComponentIterator on MMI level.

ParentArea DrawableObject::GetParentArea (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns, whether the drawable-object is drawn as part of the client area or the frame area.

When the drawable object is added to the parent control, the drawable object is drawn automatically in the client area of the parent control. Pointer to the view, which is responsible to draw the drawable object.

void DrawableObject::Invalidate (  BOOLEAN  erase = TRUE  ) 
 

Invalidates the area described by the bounding rectangle of the drawable object. This leads to a repaint of the drawable object in the next idle-state of the application.

Parameters:
erase Incicates, whether the area should be erased before Window::OnPaint is called. By default erase is TRUE.

void DrawableObject::SetNext (  DrawableObject *  next  )  [inline]
 

Sets the next drawable object for the concatenated list. Usually it is never necessary to invoke this method by the MMI.

void DrawableObject::SetParent (  Control *  parent  )  [virtual]
 

See also:
Component::SetParent

Implements Component.

void DrawableObject::SetParentArea (  ParentArea  parent_area  )  [inline]
 

Sets the parent-area of the drawable-object, where the drawing is done. Every drawable-object may added as part of the client area or the frame area of the parent control. Per default a drawable-object is added as part of the client area.

BOOLEAN DrawableObject::SetProperty (  ResourceParser &  parser,
const GuiObjectFactory::PropertyId  prop_id
) 
 

Initializes the instance by reading out a resource file generated by ARAGON. This method may not be invoked by the MMI in a direct manner and might be changed in future releases.

Reimplemented from Component.

Reimplemented in AbstractTextObject, AnimatedTextLine, ImageBox, ItemBox, PositionIndicator, ProgressBar, TextBox, and TextLine.

void DrawableObject::SetVisible (  BOOLEAN  visible  ) 
 

Obsolete - use Control::AddDrawableObject(), Control::RemoveDrawableObject to dynamically add/remove a Drawable Object to the Control.
